The meeting convened at 1:10 P.M., and introductions were performed.
It was moved by Starlin and seconded by Kimball that action of members who met at Detroit
in October b© affirmed and that the ilOO expense allowance for the present meeting b© allo¬
cated to re-equi'pping the MAEb tape network. The motion won unanimously. ^
Hill reported plans for national NABfi seminars that may be held in summer of I960: live
national x-adio networking (Midwest), professional stand axis in educational broadcasting
(Washington, D.C.), exchange of in-school TV programs (Midwest). He reiterated need of ^
replacing equipment of tape network and described recent meetings looking towards possibility
of tape network b©ihg a part of NBTRC while HAEp would function as a trade association and a
professional association but not as a network •
It was moved by Kager and seconded by Rundell that possible transfer of the NAEp taps
nstwork to the National Educational Television and Radio Center is of vital concern to
members of that when discussions between NAEb asset METRO have been reduced to specifics.
